results.title: Keeping warm
results.brief_description: Examines the problems involved in keeping people warm. Humans generate their own body heat and try to keep warm by trapping heat next to the body with layers of clothing. Houses too need proper insulation if they are to retain the warmth from heating sources. This program looks at a computer- controlled house where getting up, having a bath and watching television happen to order; saving energy and money.

results.title: Keeping up with the Joneses
results.creator_credit: Rob Brow Productions, Film Australia, Peter Johnson and Rob Brow
results.brief_description: Nancy and Jonah Jones live on the Mallee Track. He is a pig-breeder and producer and she is a mother of four young children. They are heavily involved in various arts for children and adults in a culturyally isoldated area. Deals with their busy lives as farmers, parents, teachers and art consultants.

results.title: Keeping time
results.creator_credit: Amber Collective, Lorna Powell, Sirkka Konttinen and Peter Roberts
results.brief_description: Integrates documentary footage and dramatised sequences in dealing with mother and daughter relationships. Particular reference is given to the influence of television on the family structure and shows how the mothers want their daughters to better themselves through the local dance studio.

results.title: Keeping people alive: malnutrition - the hidden killer
results.creator_credit: World Focus, Alan Hart and Ian McFarlane
results.brief_description: Malnutrition kills 15 million young children each year and damages countless more. It slowly erodes physical and mental health. More help is needed from rich nations. From “Five minutes to midnight” (Title code 506172).

results.title: Keeping ourselves safe
results.brief_description: Seven short dramatized vignettes on the subject of adults and older youths attempting to make sexual advances to children: “Fathers friend”, “The Photos”, “The Baby sitter”, “Jane and her uncle”, “The Swimming baths”, “Amanda and her father” and “On the bus”.

results.title: Keeping electricity safe inside the home
results.creator_credit: Australian Instructional Films, Sydney County Council, Jean Halliday and Lex Halliday
results.brief_description: Informative study of all the checks that should be made on day to day use of electrical equipment in the home (irons, toasters etc) and precautions to be taken with a general knowledge of electrical operation and illustrated details.

results.title: Keeping animals in the classroom
results.creator_credit: Curriculum Branch, Ministry of Education for Zoo Education Service, Ivan Gaal and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: Trevor Lunn introduces Karen Svalesen from the Zoo Education Service who examines the problems that can be encountered when keeping animals in the classroom. Suggests suitable animals and information sources to assist with animal care.

results.title: Keepin' silent
results.creator_credit: National Film and Sound Archive of Australia
results.brief_description: This compilation of footage from Australia’s silent era (1896-1930) encompasses examples of actuality, documentary, newsreels, home movies, advertisements, animation, narrative shorts and features. With piano accompaniment by Mrs Betty Magner.

results.title: Keepers of wildlife
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, George Pearson and Michael McKennirey
results.brief_description: Canada’s wilderness areas harbor some of the last remaining species of North American wildlife. This film shows what is being done by specialists of the Canadian Wildlife Service to prevent further depletion of their numbers. It is an enormous program of tabulating, banding, tagging, and, in the case of larger animals such as the bear and the buffalo, giving health check-ups. An engrossing film for any audience, replete with close-ups of animals, waterfowl, and fish.

results.title: Keepers of the mystery
results.brief_description: A Poetic travellogue of Scotland, documenting the distillation process of whisky on an industrial level, including barrel construction, blending, tasting (malt whisky and grain whiskey), Packaging and distribution. The film ends with a charming animated commercial for Whitehorse Cellar Scotch Whisky.
